moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Nf6 4. O-O Bc:
White had better continue with his development.
This achieves nothing, except for weaking the pprotectetion of of kings side,.
moves.6... Be6 7. Bxe6 fxe6: Black now has an open f-file, and a stronger centre
moves.8. d3 Qe7:
Of course black wants to castle to the Queens side.
Also this move protect e5 in case of a future d6-d5.
moves.9. Bg5 h6 10. Bh4:
Bxf6 was better, now black get to expand on the kings side.
White his King shoud be gettng nervous by now.
moves.13... Bb6 14. Na4 h5 15. Nxb6+ axb6: After b5, Na5 blacks King is safe.
moves.16. c4: White should have played h4, to protect his King
moves.16... h4 17. Bh2 g4 18. hxg4 Nxg4 19. Qd: A storm is gathering, Nxh2 is an immediate threat.
moves.24. Rf2 Qh2+:
Of course black could have played 24..., hxg2; 25.Rxg2, Qh2+;
But the Queen sacrifice is faster.
moves.25. Kf1: Kxh2 is also followed by checkmate: 25.Kxh2, hxg2+; 26.Kg1, Rh1#
